Posts.EditableText:
I come from using ADRIFT and Inform 7, and am looking at Quest 5 now. Having never used Quest before, I am a little confused trying to translate the documentation to the new beta. Is there any substantial documentation for new users yet?

I tried looking at the demos Alex posted links to (one won't open in Beta 2, btw) but I only get some very basic info from them. 

While on the subject, I was wondering about something. I notice "examine" isn't a default command in the parser. I grew up on infocom games so I use examine or exam or just ex all the time. How can I make an equivalent command for something simple like "look at"?

Or, should I start with 4.1 until there is beginner documentation?
Posts.HTML:
I come from using ADRIFT and Inform 7, and am looking at Quest 5 now. Having never used Quest before, I am a little confused trying to translate the documentation to the new beta. Is there any substantial documentation for new users yet?

While on the subject, I was wondering about something. I notice "examine" isn't a default command in the parser. I grew up on infocom games so I use examine or exam or just ex all the time. How can I make an equivalent command for something simple like "look at"?

Or, should I start with 4.1 until there is beginner documentation?

Posts.EditableText: Currently, no documentation for Quest 5 is available. Not that I know of, anyway. There's an online (incomplete) documentation [url=http://quest5.net/wiki/Main_Page:1lug7w89]HERE[/url:1lug7w89]. I think you should go with Quest 4.1 for now.
Posts.HTML:
Currently, no documentation for Quest 5 is available. Not that I know of, anyway.

There's an online (incomplete) documentation HERE.

I think you should go with Quest 4.1 for now.
